Posts.Content: stilldancin wrote: Hi Everyone ~ Hair started to fall out today so needed to share my story: I was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2009, had double mastectomy, with TRAM flap on December 21st and was lucky enough to find out that I am now cancer free.  Had ductal and lobular carcinoma but so lucky that nothing went to nodes.  Started my chemo, as preventative, on Jan 28th.  Feel good.  Noticed today that my hair is officially falling out.  Funny, have been asking around, searching websites and majority of people say hair falls out 14 or so days after 1st chemo treatment.  WOW, it is day 14 for me!  Unbelievable.  So, last weekend I decided to dye my hair BLONDE.  I am a very dark brown.  Thought, what the heck, always wanted to do it...now is the time.  It has been fun.  I am a high school teacher.  Teach dance at a wonderful gifted and talented program.  The kids LOVE the hair!!!  Makes me feel so good that I am still the "cool teacher".  They are with me all the way!  Set up a Think Pink next week in my honor.  All wearing pink.  I LOVE IT!!!  They wanted me to dye my hair pink but now I will be coming back from winter break with no hair.  That stinks.  But I will be wearing a WONDERFUL PINK SCARF and smile the entire day!!!!   I am so open with them all...they will smile too!! So, my reason for this topic is...my HAIR is falling out!!!!  This sucks!  I knew it was going to happen but when I saw it...in my hands, on the kitchen counter, on the sofa,...it SUCKS!!!!!! Going scarf shopping tomorrow.  All will be good.  I have a very good friend who just went through chemo for ovarian cancer.  Her words...bald is beautiful.  I have also heard bald is the badge of strength.  I LOVE THIS!!!!  Makes me strong.  I have been positive since day one and want to keep it up!!!  To all those feeling the way I do, going through the same crap...email me.  I would love to hear from you!!!  Hair today, actually scarf shopping tomorrow and then gone the next day.  LIFE IS GOOD!!!
